channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The unrest, which began in Minneapolis following Floyd's death on Monday after a police officer pressed a knee on his neck for more than eight minutes, has since become a national phenomenon as protesters decry years of deaths at police hands.
item.title: Curfews across the US as George Floyd riots, protests spread

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: The owners of dual group 1-winning miler Fierce Impact have turned down stud offers in favour of a Cox Plate tilt.
item.title: Fierce Impact owners favour Cox Plate tilt over stud

item.dc:creator: Harriet Alexander
item.description: The Waverley College student whose positive COVID-19 test caused the temporary closure of his school no longer had symptoms when his test returned positive.
item.title: Parents urged to stick by health guidelines after school evacuations

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus Australia updates LIVE: COVID-19 cases surpass 6 million, Australia death toll at 103

item.description: Majak Daw's extraordinary comeback to senior football has been halted by a chest injury that threatens to rule him out for the remainder of the abbreviated season.
item.title: Comeback on hold: Majak Daw tears pectoral muscle, may need surgery

item.dc:creator: Craig Mathieson
item.description: Australia's dominant pay-TV provider joins the ranks of the cluttered, low-cost streaming market. What's it like?
item.title: Binge's appeal is a vast library hidden behind Foxtel's paywall

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Prizemoney could return to normal levels in one month's time, while the return of bookies and crowds to the track on the agenda at a Racing NSW board meeting on Monday.
item.title: Racing NSW to set timetable for return to pre-COVID-19 times

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: It’s possible Reserve Bank governor Dr Philip Lowe has been reading a book about speechmaking that says: keep it simple and keep saying it until it sinks in.
item.title: The RBA has just one message for Scott Morrison and Josh Frydenberg

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: The Melbourne International Jazz Festival has squared up to the current challenge and gone digital.
item.title: These Digital Times review: Mixed results fording the streaming divide

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Victoria's escalating feud with the Morrison government over the Belt and Road Initiative shows how Beijing is exploiting differences within countries and regions, experts say.
item.title: Beijing's Belt and Road push 'exploits' leadership tensions worldwide

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: In part three of our return-to-play catch-up, get up to speed on Port Adelaide, Richmond, St Kilda, the Swans, West Coast and the Bulldogs.
item.title: How your club is shaping up for the AFL season restart: Part three

item.description: Playing in a small room packed with music gear in her Los Angeles home, Sharon Van Etten’s presentation was an unflashy affair.
item.title: Van Etten's voice transcends technical glitches in debut album flashback

item.description: The ASX is tipped stumble to into a new week as investors gauge whether the easing of lockdowns will fend off fears a COVID rally has gone too hard, too fast.
item.title: ASX poised for soft open as investors await lockdown easing

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The borders aren't opening but from noon Monday Queenslanders can travel anywhere in the state and congregate in groups of 20 in their homes and venues.
item.title: Queensland lifts ban on travel within state but borders remain shut

item.dc:creator: Madeleine Heffernan
item.description: Scotch College, one of the most expensive schools in Victoria, has frozen fees for 2021. Staff cuts and even closures are on the cards as private schools grapple with the coronavirus recession.
item.title: 'Drastic action': Fee freezes, job cuts loom for Victorian private schools

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: In what promises to be a boon for desperate tourism operators, almost a quarter of us will be on the road within days of restrictions easing on Monday.
item.title: Stir-crazy Victorians ready to hit the regions within days

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: After the NSW government scrapped plans to redevelop ANZ Stadium the NRL is set to demand it fund the construction of four new boutique grounds.
item.title: NRL's ultimatum: Four new suburban stadiums or grand final will go

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Storm playmakers Cameron Smith and Cameron Munster have backed their side to fix their issues in attack despite a short-turnaround to Friday night's clash with South Sydney Rabbitohs.
item.title: Storm back to 'drawing board' after 'embarrassing' play

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Melbourne's contemporary art gallery asked artists to imagine art that was native to cyberspace; the results are bizarre.
item.title: Digital art 'bot' flirts and chats about poetry and pop

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Daniel Taylor, the son of the Kings Cross identity, is suing News Corp for defamation over alleged claims he is "a mobster" and involved in organised crime.
item.title: Sunday Telegraph denies calling John Ibrahim's son 'a Mafia figure'

item.description: The Roosters forward was hit with a grade-one charge for a lifting tackle on South Sydney winger Dane Gagai.
item.title: Radley to fight ban for Gagai tackle at NRL judiciary

item.description: After Canberra became the NRL's premiership favourites by smashing Melbourne, the good news kept coming for the Green Machine.
item.title: Raiders flying but landing in Canberra brings a "massive cheer"

item.dc:creator: Cameron Myles
item.description: The Puutu Kunti Kurrama and Pinikura Aboriginal Corporation claim they only learned of the miner’s plans to blast the sites earlier in May, when they were making their own plans to access them for NAIDOC Week celebrations.
item.title: Rio Tinto knew of 46,000-year-old Pilbara site's significance 'as recently as March', traditional owners say

item.description: Coaching legend Mick Malthouse says only half a dozen teams are capable of winning the AFL premiership in the coronavirus-hit 2020 season.
item.title: Malthouse tips six-team AFL flag race

item.description: The Melbourne Storm skipper concedes the Raiders played a superior style of football under one referee.
item.title: Storm must adapt to faster game, admits Smith after Raiders rout

item.description: David Levine had the unhappy distinction of presiding over the country’s longest defamation case in a long and distinguished career.
item.title: Book-loving judge interested in 'humanities and inhumanities'

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: With cinemas closed during the pandemic, drive-ins that have stayed open around the world have been doing well.
item.title: Bluffers guide: Is the drive-in making a comeback?

item.description: Indigenous artist Hannah Bronte wants her work to break down barriers of age, skin colour and gender to deliver a vital message.
item.title: She Persists in art: reflecting on a powerful new voice

item.description: The Liverpool-born actor took over from former Beatles member Ringo Starr as storyteller of Thomas the Tank Engine And Friends in 1991.
item.title: Narrator of Thomas the Tank Engine dies

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: A coronavirus outbreak has infected 13 people from two households in Keilor Downs, as cafes, pubs and restaurants across the state prepare to welcome back patrons on Monday.
item.title: Victorian government scrambling to contain coronavirus outbreak in Melbourne's north-west

item.description: American international Weston McKennie showed his support for George Floyd during Schalke's Bundesliga match with Werder Bremen.
item.title: Schalke player shows US protests support

item.description: Iran has taken Washington to task over the killing of a black man by a white police officer that has sparked angry protests over racial injustice.
item.title: Iran berates US over police killing, slams racism

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Bar owner Daniel Startup is thankful pubs and restaurants can start serving up to 50 customers at one time, but has given a heads up to excited patrons the vibe might be different.
item.title: 'Vibe might be off': Here's what's opening from Monday, and how things will be different

item.description: Amir Farid demonstrated bravery, brilliance and empathy in taking on one of classical piano's most demanding set pieces.
item.title: Schumann's difficult Carnaval demands heart and mind in tune

item.description: The 2.5 centimetre creature helped pave the way for the throngs that would eventually inhabit Earth's dry parts.
item.title: Millipede from Scotland world's oldest-known land animal, say scientists

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: Margaret River gets most of the attention, not just from wine scribes but retailers too, so if you stumble across a wine from the Great Southern at your local bottle-o, dance out the door with it.
item.title: Great Southern Land: Ripe time to taste tour WA's other top wine region

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: A 22-year-old man has been charged after a shocking car crash that killed a visually impaired man and his guide dog in northern Victoria.
item.title: Man, 22, charged over death of pedestrian and guide dog

item.description: Formula One can start its season in Austria with two races behind closed doors on July 5 and 12, the country's health ministry said on Saturday.
item.title: Austria gives go-ahead to crowd-free F1 races

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: The Attorney-General has accepted the bungled scheme was unlawful and has not ruled out the Commonwealth paying damages.
item.title: Porter concedes robodebt scheme unlawful, doesn't rule out further damages

item.description: The Australian Rugby League Commission has announced plans to kick-off a competitive selection process for an extra team in Queensland.
item.title: Brisbane Bombers chase extra NRL slot

item.description: Bob Hammond, an Australian Football Hall of Fame member who was the inaugural chairman of the Crows and oversaw their two premierships, has died aged 78.
item.title: Bob Hammond dies aged 78

item.description: The trans-Australian speed record was broken by R.A.A.F. planes twice, within the space of seven minutes, when a Lincoln Bomber and a Mosquito returned from Perth to Point Cook.
item.title: From the Archives, 1947: Trans-Australian flight record broken twice in one day

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Police believe the pair had recently broken up and were trying to get back together when the man stabbed the woman before stabbing himself at a home in Sydney's west.
item.title: 'Tragic loss of life': Two dead after man kills woman in double stabbing

item.description: New York is a major COVID-19 hotspot but US Open organisers are investigating charter flights and bubble accommodation for players.
item.title: US Open tennis plan for August still in the works

item.description: "They could come and arrest me in five minutes," says Palfreeman, who has maintained he acted in self-defence in relation to his murder conviction.
item.title: 'Not free yet': Palfreeman fears re-arrest in Bulgaria, seeks new trial

item.description: President Trump says he will postpone meeting of Group of 7 nations until September and has called for an expansion of the body to include Australia.
item.title: Donald Trump says he wants Australia to join G7

item.description: The Premier League has been given government approval to press ahead with its June 17 restart although players will have to stay apart during goal celebrations and disputes.
item.title: Premier League cleared for June restart

item.dc:creator: Felicity Lewis
item.description: National security laws set to be made for Hong Kong have been called a "death knell" and "badly damaging". Why are they so controversial?
item.title: Protest or dangerous subversion: what China’s proposed national security laws mean for Hong Kong

item.description: A motorcyclist has died after crashing into a car while evading police on Queensland's Fraser Coast.
item.title: Motorcyclist dies while evading Queensland police

item.description: One man is fighting for life while another has been charged with attempted murder following a confrontation with three men in north Queensland.
item.title: Queensland man facing attempted murder charge
